Package fr.univartois.cril.approximation.solver

Class SolverConfiguration

java.lang.Object
fr.univartois.cril.approximation.solver.SolverConfiguration
public class SolverConfiguration extends Object
The SolverConfiguration class defines the configuration settings for an approximation-based solver. It encapsulates various parameters controlling the solverâ€™s execution, such as the number of failed, solution limits, relaxation strategies, and path selection strategies.

This class provides getter and setter methods to update configuration parameters dynamically, along with an update() method that generates a new configuration based on scaling factors.

Configuration Parameters:

  • nbFailed: The number of failed allowing during the resolution.
  • factor: A scaling factor applied to the number of failed.
  • limitSolution: The maximum number of solutions allowed.
  • ratio: A threshold ratio affecting solver transitions.
  • remover: A strategy defining how constraints are removed during approximation.
  • pathStrategy: The path strategy that defines how constraints are reintroduced during state transitions.
    • in state transitions.

  • Constructor Details

    • SolverConfiguration

      public SolverConfiguration(int nbFailed, double factor, long limitSolution, double ratio)
      Creates a new SolverConfiguration instance with the specified parameters. This configuration determines how the solver behaves when handling failed attempts, adjusting solving parameters dynamically based on predefined scaling factors.
      Parameters:
      nbFailed - the initial number of allowed failed attempts before adjustments
      factor - the scaling factor applied when updating the solver's behavior
      limitSolution - the maximum number of solutions the solver is allowed to find
      ratio - the threshold ratio that influences state transitions in the solver

  • Method Details

    • getNbFailed

      public int getNbFailed()
      Retrieves the current number of failed attempts before a solver adjustment is triggered.
      Returns:
      the number of failed attempts before state adaptation

    • setNbFailed

      public void setNbFailed(int nbFailed)
      Updates the number of failed attempts before a solver adjustment is triggered.
      Parameters:
      nbFailed - the new number of failed attempts before adaptation

    • getFactor

      public double getFactor()
      Retrieves the scaling factor applied when updating solver behavior.
      Returns:
      the scaling factor affecting solver adjustments

    • setFactor

      public void setFactor(double factor)
      Sets the scaling factor that controls solver adjustments.
      Parameters:
      factor - the new scaling factor

    • getLimitSolution

      public long getLimitSolution()
      Retrieves the maximum number of solutions the solver is allowed to find.
      Returns:
      the solution limit imposed on the solver

    • setLimitSolution

      public void setLimitSolution(long limitSolution)
      Updates the maximum number of solutions the solver is allowed to find.
      Parameters:
      limitSolution - the new solution limit

    • getRatio

      public double getRatio()
      Retrieves the threshold ratio that influences solver state transitions.
      Returns:
      the threshold ratio affecting the solver's decision-making process

    • update

      public SolverConfiguration update()
      Generates an updated solver configuration by applying the scaling factor to the number of failed attempts. The new configuration retains the same factor, solution limit, and ratio while inheriting the remover and path strategy.
      Returns:
      a new SolverConfiguration instance with updated parameters

    • getRemover

      public IConstraintsRemover getRemover()
      Retrieves the constraint removal strategy associated with this configuration.
      Returns:
      the constraint remover strategy

    • setRemover

      public void setRemover(IConstraintsRemover remover)
      Sets the constraint removal strategy used by the solver.
      Parameters:
      remover - the new constraint remover strategy

    • getPathStrategy

      public PathStrategy getPathStrategy()
      Retrieves the path strategy defining how constraints are reintroduced during state transitions.
      Returns:
      the current path strategy used by the solver

    • setPathStrategy

      public void setPathStrategy(PathStrategy pathStrategy)
      Updates the path strategy that determines how constraints are reintroduced during solver state transitions.
      Parameters:
      pathStrategy - the new path strategy
